title: ACADEMY Lifelong Learning Suite
description: Acquiring and maintaining knowledge needs a radically new approach. The methods of early industrial society are insufficient & outdated.

f6_assessments.q0:
The challenge is asking for a way to drive mass-scale adoption of DID usage as an easy-to-use onramp to the Cardano ecosystem.
The problem statement should more closely align with the challenge however the solution is clear and reasonable.
The goal of creating the MINDCARDS app with DID integration aligns with the challenge objective.
The solution may be able to scale to drawing in millions of DID users however the proposal does not make the case for mass-scaling. The proposal requires future funding before any significant DID usage.The proposal predicts 5000 users in 12 months for a cost of $45,000 which is $9.00 per DID user which is on the high side compared to other proposals however over time as more users are added that rate would drop. 
Based upon my experience, I agree that this proposal effectively addresses the challenge.
f6_assessments.q1:
The proposer has provided sufficient evidence of relevant skills and experience needed to implement the proposal in the form of references or links.
The team has been sufficiently identified in terms of skills and number required to implement the proposal.
The budget is reasonable to achieve the goals compared to similar proposals but is not broken down into identifiable items.
Additional funding is required to develop the product to the point that the challenge objectives would be met, the proposer has not provided a plan on obtaining these funds other than they are professional and outside Catalyst. 
The timetable is realistic to complete the work and shows what is being done and when.
The plan does not describe the resources necessary to implement the proposal.
The proposal does not identify risks and challenges to a successful implementation. The largest risk is that future funding is not obtained and the MVP closes down due to lack of funds. There is no mention of open source code which could be used by other community members to continue if desired.
Based upon my experience, I agree that it is highly likely that this proposal will be implemented successfully.
f6_assessments.q2:
The proposal provides a roadmap with auditable milestones and a defined timeline.
The proposal has projected metrics that correspond to the challenge objective such as the number of DID users projected to be onboarded at specific time intervals and the recruitment cost per DID user although they should be projected out farther.
The proposal details several ways progress will be reported back to the Catalyst community at regular intervals.
Based upon my experience, I agree that this proposal provides me with sufficient information to assess the progress in attaining its stated goals.

f6_assessments.q0: This proposal is for a learning suite and the technology associated with the proposer's website appears to be very well thought out and organized. ACADEMY Suite is a unique way to engage lifelong learning, allowing you to capture, retrieve and share personal knowledge.
f6_assessments.q1: There are 3 core team members with a strong background in learning-methods and innovation, complemented by senior leadership experience in industry. There may need to be an additional member that has a specific focus on blockchain technology.
f6_assessments.q2: This proposal will be easy to audit based on the budget provided and time required to implement. There are several significant milestones mentioned, and the best KPIs are based on the number of downloads and partnerships within 12 months.

f6_assessments.q0:
This is a very well written proposal. Before reading this proposals the reader should watch the RSA animate video (sir ken robinson) to understand the big picture. The proposal itself has been very well thought out and directly addresses one of the major issues in our modern society (how do ensure we can continue to innovate as a society) by developing a platform that will allow creativity to flourish and be recognised.
As a teacher, sports coach, project manager and parent i see huge benefit from what is trying to be achieved here.

The only advice i would give to the proposers is to find a way to reach out to the community with a bitesize pitch, unfortunately i don't think many people will take the time to digest this proposal in its entirety (i hope i'm wrong)
f6_assessments.q1: The plan and budget is for this 1st phase is sensible and although the team is not yet fully formed, the experience and backgrounds of the proposers provides confidence that the project will be successfully and any issues/risks managed appropriately.
f6_assessments.q2: The milestones and success indicators are transparent and progress will be visible via the kanban board.

f6_assessments.q0:
This challenge asks how we can reach mass scale adoption of PRISM and DIDs. This proposal aims to do that by building a learning tool which issues verified credentials to the users of the tool. 

This proposal effectively outlines a problem with the current education system and proposes a product based solution which alters the mechanics of education - from a factory based model to a highly personalized model. 

The proposal lays out easy to understand 3, 6 and 12 month milestones. 

It's not clear how this project aims to get adoption. There are high level ideas of partnering with universities but there aren't lower level details. Which universities? Which jurisdictions? What guerilla marketing techniques will be used? 

I think the general idea here will scale quite well since it's a software based approach and software generally scales quite well.

I give this proposal a score of 4 for impact because it's lacking a detailed marketing plan which means it's hard to estimate how many people the product will affect.
f6_assessments.q1:
The team has lots of experience especially considering the industry experience of Hans who has been a professional for decades. I think the team could have done a better job outlining why their skills are particularly well suited to this challenge. 

This project also seems to have very little done so far since so many of the milestones are foundational steps like architecture blueprints, white papers, and business model canvas. 

The team is also missing one of the key team members, a blockchain/DID expert. 

The implementation plan is missing details but lays out a good skeleton. It's great that they want to start with foundational building blocks before building a product but more details would be nice. 

I give this proposal a score of 3 because it lacks many details about why this particular team will succeed and given the fact that the project still seems to be in the research phase.
f6_assessments.q2:
The proposal does a good job breaking up the milestones into 3, 6 and 12 month goals. Each of the markers have a good breakdown of tasks. 

However, it's not clear where the proposal will host some of their documents like the whitepaper. They mention using MIRO for the business model canvas but it's not clear if that will be used for all documents. More clarity on document hosting would be great. 

Even though the milestones are broken down into tasks, some of the tasks are quite vague. How can the community verify if "Required operational infrastructure for working as globally distributed teams established" or 
"Foundational-developments completed" are done? What exactly do those things mean? How big will the team be that it needs significant investment in global operational infrastructure? what are the foundational developments? 

It would be nice if more the milestones/metrics were numeric in nature like the milestone of "Achieved 5000+ downloads for Mindcards MVP".

I give this proposal a score 3 for auditability because it lacks some details and some of the milestones are not auditable by the community.
f6_assessments.reply:
I am flagging this CA, because I see a very problematic BIAS here. Why ?
1) I brought this team of proposers to Fund 6. I am acting as their senior advisor and co-proposer. The team initially planned to develop this as a 'traditional application'. I successfully convinced the proposing team that without DID & tokenomics-foundation, a lot of future opportunities will be missed. 
2) This means that this proposer team is NEW TO CARDANO AND CATALYST - ISN'T THIS SOMETHING WE WANT ? According to this proposer it seem to be hard to join from 'outside'. Apparently he also assumes that CATALYST proposals need to already be realized, asking for retrospective funding - this is the only way I ever could imagine how the requested information could be seriously provided. In my eyes this is a very critical BIAS. 
3) The ACADEMY team made this proposal within the ATALA PRISM DID challenge setting, because here we can interact with the right experts for INTEGRATING our DID approach with what is already emerging or already available (technically and also with selected universities and institutions). 
4) Therefore putting FOUNDATIONAL WORK as part of this proposal is NOT A WEAKNESS, BUT A NECCESSITY !
5) What is critizised here are lacking details, which
 a) Either are already there in our MIRO working environment, which are way too detailed for integrating this ino a proposal like this and require a 'guided tour', or 
b) Cannot be there by nature, since we want to use this Challenge Setting for creating something really new and future-oriented. 
c) There is a complete (clickable) POC of the MINDCARDS functionality already available and shown on our WEBSITE. From the functional perspective, we are far beyond 'idea phase'.
